author: BouwenMA
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement
Have the "Get-Help -ShowWindow" option show the resulting window with a dark/inverse mode, where the background is black and the text is white, or follow the system theme option like Windows 10 now has for light/dark.  

<!-- 
A clear and concise description of what the problem is that the new feature would solve.
Try formulating it in user story style (if applicable):
'As a user I want X so that Y.' with X being the being the action and Y being the value of the action.
-->

# Proposed technical implementation details
Possible options for specifying light/dark:
- If running Windows, then follow the system theme setting
- New PSPreferences variable
- Another switch on Get-Help like -ShowDarkWindow or -Dark

This is by no means a high priority.  With the new Windows Terminal and VScode now being nice with theming capabilities, this would be an eye-friendly enhancement.

<!-- 
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
Consider providing an example PowerShell experience with expected result.
-->
title: Feature Request: Get-Help -ShowWindow Option Dark/Inverse Mode - Or follow system theme
